discussion_comments.comment_body:
**Explanation**
- The rule `/tests/format/**/*.*` ignores `tests/format/flow-repo/esproposal_decorators.ignore`, that is the parent of `tests/format/flow-repo/esproposal_decorators.ignore/format.test.js`. This caused the problem because we can't re-include paths that has ignored parents.
- The rule `!/tests/format/**/*.*/` re-includes `tests/format/flow-repo/esproposal_decorators.ignore`. This re-inclusion is not prevented by the rule above because its parent `tests/format/flow-repo` is not ignored.
- Finally the rule `!/tests/format/**/format.test.js` works fine because the parent of `tests/format/flow-repo/esproposal_decorators.ignore/format.test.js` is no longer ignored. We can re-include it.
if we have a `tests/format/flow-repo/esproposal_decorators.ignore/foo/format.test.js`, will it be unignored?

I remember that I did something strange in eslint too https://github.com/prettier/prettier/blob/1652973553677de297782643ca0263f6331eb0d3/eslint.config.js#L21-L25

Does it work for prettier?
Yes, I created `tests/format/flow-repo/esproposal_decorators.ignore/foo/format.test.js` containing ugly javascript locally and ran `yarn lint:prettier`. It warned.
As I tested, use the same pattern as https://github.com/prettier/prettier/pull/17632#discussion_r2160047355 works too.
Oh I missed the second question. I agree that the pattern in eslintignore works fine for prettier too.
I prefer using `"error"` in even non CI environment.
I agree with @sosukesuzuki , since this rule autofixable, "error" should be used.

Done in https://github.com/prettier/prettier/pull/15817/commits/49394466ed48ee3971c264322de483ed30f785fe

Note that we still have `isCI` here:

https://github.com/prettier/prettier/blob/863368e1ba915eb885eca20c493ddad740cb8df2/.eslintrc.cjs#L35

I used to use `"error"` everywhere, but my colleague @undg persuaded me to switch to `"warn"` for rules like these. If something may lead to a crash, it’s marked as an error. If something is just not good enough for a merge, it’s a warning.

Both warnings and errors produce a non-zero exit code. Here are our `package.json` scripts:

```json
    "fix:eslint": "eslint --max-warnings=0 --fix \"**/*\"",
    "...": "...",
    "lint:eslint": "eslint --max-warnings=0 \"**/*\"",
```

When it comes to `"simple-import-sort/imports"`, using `"warn"` is quite handy. It allows us to see incorrect order as well as broken imports within. I was at first hesitant to use `"warn"` at all because I did not know about `--max-warnings=0`. But these two levels of feedback make total sense to me now. There is no need for `isCI` inside `.eslintrc.cjs` too.

I think current settings for `no-console` is fine too.

Story behind it https://github.com/prettier/prettier/pull/10322#issuecomment-779277567

https://github.com/prettier/prettier/pull/12162 https://github.com/prettier/prettier/pull/12182

Is it expected to see this version alongside `"@typescript-eslint/typescript-estree@5.20.0"` (which is also present in `yarn.lock`)? Just checking if we need to `yarn dedupe` or keep things as is.

Same with `@typescript-eslint/types@5.43.1-alpha.22+a4f85b8c` / `@typescript-eslint/types@5.36.2`
`yarn dedupe` not available in `main` branch. It uses classic yarn.
But we should dedupe before merge.
We can use [yarn-deduplicate](https://www.npmjs.com/package/yarn-deduplicate) or just manually edit `yarn.lock` then. Removing duplicate older entries manually and running `yarn install` may work.
FYI Some other packages are duduped by `npx yarn-dedupulicate`. [90d6098](https://github.com/prettier/prettier/pull/13872/commits/90d6098cf250ec25714e10b15ba39594c24d04fe)

Nice! The majority of deduplicated deps are related to tests and linting, which suggests low risk. I hope to see automatic deduplication in Yarn Berry one day: https://github.com/yarnpkg/berry/issues/4976 🤞
https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/releases/tag/v5.44.0 is out 🕺
